poem:
Title: "The Elders Awake"

Bank and Fund, aged yet vital,
parley in Washington's autumn calm.
No fresh crisis on the global dial,
but world-wounds bear a sobering balm.
Octogenarian stewards, sprightly nonetheless, 
their half-century travail strikes a solemn chord -
But in their wisdom, a silent redress 
ensures history's fraught accord.
